nav.div: School Administrative Unit 9 » COVID-19 Information » Employee Resources

p.span: The Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA or Act) requires certain employers to provide their employees with paid sick leave and expanded family and medical leave for specified reasons related to COVID-19. These provisions will apply from April 1, 2020 through December 31, 2020.

br.br:
Request for Families First Coronavirus Response Act Leave - Digital Form *Please download/ save to your computer BEFORE you complete.
FFCRA OVERVIEW:

li.span: In general, all SAU#9 employees are eligible for up to two weeks of fully or partially paid sick leave for COVID-19 related reasons (see qualifying reasons below).

Employees who have been employed for at least 30 days prior to their request for leave may be eligible for up to an additional 10 weeks of partially paid expanded family and medical leave for reason #5 below.

span.em: *Please note that you can only receive the additional 10 weeks of expanded family and medical leave under this Emergency Family and Medical Leave Expansion Act to care for your child whose school or place of care is closed, or childcare provider is unavailable due to COVID-19 related reasons AND you are unable to perform your duties including being unable to work remotely.

strong.span: QUALIFYING REASONS FOR LEAVE RELATED TO COVID-19

span.strong: An employee is entitled to take leave related to COVID-19 if the employee is unable to work, including unable to telework, because the employee:

br.span:
Up to two weeks (80 hours, or a part-time employee's two-week equivalent) of paid sick leave based on the higher of their regular rate of pay, or the applicable state or Federal minimum wage, paid at:
• For reasons #1-3 above: 100%, up to $511 daily and $5,110 total
• For reasons #4 & #6 above: 2/3 pay, up to $200 daily and $2,000 total
• For Reason #5 above: Up to 10 weeks more of paid sick leave and expanded family and medical leave paid at 2/3, up to $200 daily and $12,000 total.
*A part-time employee is eligible for leave for the number of hours that the employee is normally scheduled to work over that period.

strong.span: DOCUMENTATION REQUIREMENTS TO ACCESS FFCRA LEAVE

span.style: box-sizing: inherit; font-size: 17px; font-weight: bolder !important; font-family: "Source Sans Pro", sans-serif; color: rgb(33, 33, 33);

br.span: What documents do I need to give the SAU9 office to access paid sick leave or expanded family and medical leave under FFCRA?

span.style: box-sizing: inherit; font-size: 17px; font-weight: bolder !important; font-family: "Source Sans Pro", sans-serif; color: rgb(33, 33, 33);
font-size: 17px; font-family: "Source Sans Pro", sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

a.title: Request for Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA) Leave Form

span.a: Request for Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA) Leave Form

strong.span: *Please download/ save to your computer BEFORE you complete.

span.style: font-size: 17px; font-family: "Source Sans Pro", sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

li.span: Documentation to support your qualifying reason for paid leave (medical note, notice of closure of schools/care facility, etc.)
li.strong: For Expanded Family and Medical Leave:
li.span: (to care for your child whose school or place of care is closed, or child care provider is unavailable, due to COVID-19-related reasons) examples of acceptable documentation include: a notice of closure or unavailability from your child’s school, place of care, or child care provider, including a notice that may have been posted on a government, school, or daycare website, published in a newspaper, or emailed to you from an employee or official of the school, place of care, or child care provider.

span.strong: Please send completed FFCRA request form and any supporting documentation to Siiri Chase at s_chase@sau9.org.
